text: The , also known as the Asuka Kiyomihara Code,Varley, H. Paul, ed. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 136 n43. are Japanese laws which were written in 668-672. The code was created by Fujiwara no Kamatari. The Ōmi Code was 22 volumes long. It was put into effect in the last year of Emperor Tenji's reign.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1959). The Imperial House of Japan, p. 52. This code was an early version of the Taihō Code of 701. == References == Category:7th century in Japan Category:Legislation Category:660s Category:670s
title: Ōmi Code
